medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 28 months ago with right flank pain and hematuria. Over time, the patient developed severe, intermittent pleuritic left-sided chest pain and exertional dyspnea, worsening with episodes of hemoptysis. Nausea and daily vomiting without blood were persistent. These symptoms progressed with recent worsening in exertional dyspnea occurring one week before admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of right nephroureterectomy due to grade 3 papillary transitional-cell carcinoma, completion of adjuvant chemotherapy 25 months ago, and multiple computed tomography (CT) scans showing disease progression.
medical_history.social_history: The patient worked in sales and had a remote history of alcohol abuse along with a 20-pack-year history of cigarette smoking. He lost about 14 kg in weight in recent months.
